ygData.subject: Re: BEST PLAYER COMBO
ygData.msgSnippet: Erudite/Necro Erudite/Enchanter Halfing/Druid Dwarf/Rogue Wood Elf/Ranger Ogre/Shadow Knight Human/Monk Much debate here.
ygData.messageBody:
"Erudite/Necro<br> Erudite/Enchanter<br>
Halfing/Druid<br> Dwarf/Rogue<br> Wood Elf/Ranger<br> Ogre/Shadow
Knight<br> Human/Monk"<br><br>Much debate here. Depends on
what you mean by good.<br><br>Erudite-- yeah. I can
accept those first although there's strong competition
with High Elven Enchanters. Erudite Necro sounds about
right to me. Can't think of better.<br><br>Halfling
druid is good. Big debate with this one
<br>"Dwarf/Rogue" Off the top of my head I can think of two better.
Halfling rogue and Barbarian rogues both rock a lot more.
Halflings start off in a great killing area. Halflings get
good stats with the Dex. Barbarians can't be stunned
from the front and Barbs seem like a good choice. Then
there are those that argue that DE rogue is
best.<br><br>And there's no real competition though for Monk. Has
to be Iskar monk. Despite the locational drawback,
the regen alone makes Iskar more worth while. Having
forage at char gen helps too in terms of -- money issues
are always a concern with monks. They can't carry
over 14 stones (unless you're a high level and then I
think max is what-- 20 stones at 60?)<br><br>Overall,
human stats aren't as good as Iskar stats for the
primary monk stats. And then you can't see nearly as well
with Human monks. Not sure why human monk would make
the list except for the ability to go to placed
without being KOS. (which is important but not compared
to the others-- otherwise a Troll or Ogre Warrior
wouldn't be nearly as popular as they are
now.)<br><br>shooman out
